text: <a href="../2-Timothy-1-1/" title="2 Timothy 1:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-2/" title="2 Timothy 1:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 To Timothy, *my* dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, *and* peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-3/" title="2 Timothy 1:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 I thank God, whom I serve from *my* forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;
<a href="../2-Timothy-1-4/" title="2 Timothy 1:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-5/" title="2 Timothy 1:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-6/" title="2 Timothy 1:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.
<a href="../2-Timothy-1-7/" title="2 Timothy 1:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-8/" title="2 Timothy 1:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-9/" title="2 Timothy 1:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Who hath saved us, and called *us* with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-10/" title="2 Timothy 1:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:
<a href="../2-Timothy-1-11/" title="2 Timothy 1:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-12/" title="2 Timothy 1:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-13/" title="2 Timothy 1:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
<a href="../2-Timothy-1-14/" title="2 Timothy 1:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-15/" title="2 Timothy 1:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-16/" title="2 Timothy 1:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:
<a href="../2-Timothy-1-17/" title="2 Timothy 1:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found *me*.

<a href="../2-Timothy-1-18/" title="2 Timothy 1:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.
